Name: Driver
Notes: To Wantage Tramway 1919 possibly per J.F. Wake, scrapped 1920 owing to defective steampipe

Name: Gunner
Notes: To J.F. Wake 1919, sold to Castner-Kellner Alkali Co. Ltd., Cheshire, scrapping date unknown

Name: Pioneer
Notes: To Isherwood & Co. (contractor), Brentford 1920, sold or scrapped shortly after 6/1920

Name: Caesar
Notes: To Holloway Bros. (contractors) Winchester circa 1919, scrapping date unknown

Name: Lord Napier
Notes: Arsenal records say scrapped 1/1916 but remains still extant 9/1947 according to Railway Observer magazine (RCTS)

Name: Bombard
Notes: To British Mannesmann Tube Co. Landore 1920 per Williams & Co., scrapping date unknown

Name: Vulcan
Notes: Disposal unknown, probably scrapped during First World War

Name: Cyclops
Notes: To Currie, Rowlands & Co., Birkenhead, 1920 per Williams & Co.. To Cudworth & Johnson Ltd., Wrexham 1947 (loaned to William Lee, Seacombe 1950-64), scrapped 6/1964

Name: Lord Kitchener
Notes: To Walter Scott & Middleton (contractors), White Nile Dam, Sudan by 9/1920. To Pauling & Co. Ltd. (Contractors), Park Royal, London by 1950 and transferred to Crymlyn Burrows Depot. Sold to Benjamin Hughes & Co. Ltd., Loughor, Glamorgan 2/1950 and scrapped 1964

Name: The Colonel
Notes: History up to and including transfer to Paulings Crymlyn Burrows Depot as Bagnall 1702. Returned to Park Royal Depot by 7/1951 and scrapped 6/1954

Name: The Master General
Notes: To Frank Edmunds, dealer,1922, thence to Mersey Docks & Harbour Board, Liverpool

Name: George
Notes: To New Westbury Iron Co. Ltd. after 10/1921. To thurrock Chalk & Whiting Co. Ltd., Essex, 1939 and to T.W. Ward & Co. Ltd., Grays, for scrap 3/1966

Name: Mary
Notes: To Pease & Partners, Stockton, 1921

Name: Mercury
Notes: To Frank Edmunds 1921, thence to Glasgow Iron & Steel Co. Ltd., Wishaw, Lanarks. To Pease & Partners Ltd., Normanby Ironworks, Yorks. 9/1948

Name: Mars
Notes: To Thomas Ward & Co. Ltd., Sheffield, circa 1921, thence to Esholt Sewage Works, Yorks.

Name: Neptune
Notes: To New Westbury Iron Co. Ltd. 1920, sold to Finedon Ironestone Pits 1939

Name: Jupiter
Notes: To Thomas Ward & Co. Ltd., Sheffield, circa 1921, thence to Esholt Sewage Works, Yorks.

Name: Saturn
Notes: To Bute Works Supply Co. Ltd., Cardiff, 1920 thence to Elba Tinplate Works, Nr. Swansea 1923; to Velindre Tinplate Works circa 1954 and scrapped circa 1958

Name: Undaunted
Notes: To G. Cohen, Sons & Co. Ltd., Canning Town for scrap 10/3/1954

Name: Liberty
Notes: Scrapped on site by W. Arnott Young & Co. Ltd. 8/1963

Name: Arethusa
Notes: To T. Hall & Co. (Llanshamlet), dealer, 1949, thence to Stella South Power Station, Blaydon-on-Tyne 12/1952. To Blaydon Generating Station 11/1955; scrapped 1965

Name: Laurel
Notes: Disposal as Hawthorn Leslie 3083 but on 16/12/1957

Name: Fearless
Notes: To Holland, Hannen & Cubitts Ltd. (Contractors), Kent, 1927 sold or scrapped after 1930

Name: Invincible
Notes: Withdrawn 1956, to RAE Farnborough 1959, now at Isle of Wight Steam Railway, Havenstreet, I.o.W.

Name: Lennox
Notes: To stationary boiler use by 1959, sold to J. Hardwick, Sons & Co. Ltd., West Ewell, for scrap 10/1959

Name: Lark
Notes: As Hawthorn Leslie 3090 in 1949, thence to Steel Company Of Wales Ltd., Port Talbot, scrapped 1954

Name: Lance
Notes: To South Staffs Mond Gas Company, Dudley Port, Staffs. circa 1920. To J. Cashmore for scrap 1952

Name: Lynx
Notes: To Whitwood Chemical Co. Ltd., West Yorks. circa 1920

Name: Legion
Notes: Disposal as Hawthorn Leslie 3089

Name: Leonidas
Notes: To G. Simm (Machinery) Ltd. 11/4/1949 thence to T.Hall & Co.(Llansamlet) Ltd, dealer, 1949. To Norton Hill Colliery, Somerset 1951, scrapped circa 1955

Name: Loyal
Notes: To J. Hardwick, Sons & Co. Ltd., West Ewell for scrap 5/1964

Name: Lucifer
Notes: To T. Hall & Co. (Llansamlet) Ltd. 1949 thence to NCB Graigola Fuel Works, Swansea, 1950. To Caerphilly Tar Distillation Plant 3/1959, thence to J. Pesci & Sons Ltd. for scrap circa 1961; scrapped circa 3/1963

Name: Larne
Notes: To J. Cashmore, Great Bridge, Staffs for scrap 7/1959

Name: Leviathan
Notes: As Hawthorn Leslie 3186 but sale date 9/1961

Name: Linnett
Notes: As Hawthorn Leslie 3160 but sale date 10/1959

Name: Lurcher
Notes: To T. Hall & Co. (Llansamlet) Ltd. 1949, thence to Armstrong Whitworth & Co. Ltd., Newcastle 5/1953 and scrapped 1966

Name: Cynthia
Notes: To Dowlow Lime & Stone Co. Ltd., Buxton, Derbyshire, 1921

Name: Cleopatra
Notes: To J. Lyons & Co. Ltd., Greenford, Middlesex 1921

Name: Lion
Notes: To T. Hall & Co. (Llansamlet) Ltd. 1949, thence to Wallend Slipway & Engineering Co. Ltd., Northumberland 3/1950. To Chasewater Railway, Staffs 10/1974, thence to Foxfield Railway 1/1975 and currently at Lincolnshire Wolds Railway

Name: Tiger
Notes: To Woodham Bros., Barry Dock, Glamorgan for scrap, 7/1963

Name: Africa
Notes: Disposal as Hawthorn Leslie 3186

Name: Australia
Notes: Disposal as Peckett 1352

Name: Canada
Notes: To H. Bean, Gillingham, Kent for scrap 5/1964, sold on to Lacmonts Ltd., Sheerness and scrapped 6/1964

Name: New Zealand
Notes: Sold or scrapped by 1951

Name: Valiant
Notes: Disposal as for Andrew Barclay 1188

Name: Vanguard
Notes: To Brereton Collieries Ltd., Staffordshire, 1920, thence to Rawnsley Shed 8/1959. To Hamstead Colliey, Staffordshire 1/1961 and scrapped 11/1962

Name: Vengeance
Notes: To Salt Union Ltd., Worcestershire, 1923

Name: Venerable
Notes: To C.D. Phillips Ltd., dealer, Newport, Monmouthshire, 1923, thence to Trafford Park Estates Ltd., Manchester

Name: Haig
Notes: To Coltness Iron Co. Ltd., Newmains, Lanarks., 10/1957, scrapped circa 9/1963

Name: Beatty
Notes: Withdrawn by 1956, to E.L. Pitt Ltd., Brackley, Northants., dealer, to Oxfordshire Ironstone Co. Ltd., Banbury, Oxfordshire, 1/1958 to G. Cohen & Co. Ltd. for scrap 6/1965

Name: French
Notes: Disposal as Hawthorn Leslie 3186

Name: Marlborough
Notes: To ROF Chorley, Lancashire, 6/1941

Name: Wellington
Notes: Disposal as Andrew Barclay 2081

Name: Roberts
Notes: Disposal as Andrew Barclay 2081 but date unknown

Name: Fisher
Notes: Disposal as Andrew Barclay 2081 but date of transfer 18/12/1940

Name: Kitchener
Notes: Disposal as Hawthorn Leslie 3186 but sale date 8/1959

Name: Allenby
Notes: To E.L. Pitt & Co., Brackley, Northants., dealers, 8/1959 scrapped shortly afterwards

Name: Jellicoe
Notes: Disposal as Peckett 1872

Name: Byng
Notes: Disposal as Peckett 1872 but sale date 9/1961

Name: Horne
Notes: Loaned to RAE Farnborough 3/1957-10/7/1959; final disposal as Peckett 1983

Name: Alexander
Notes: To APCM, Kent Works, Stone, Kent circa 1949, sold for scrap 1967

Name: Sturdee
Notes: Disposal as Peckett 1983
To ROF Wilford, Notts. Sold to Birds Commercial Motors Ltd., Long Marston, Warwicks. by 1969

Name: George
Notes: To ROF, Crossgates, Leeds, 12/1966

Name: Elizabeth
Notes: To WD Bicester, Oxfordshire, 6/1967

Name: Kent
Notes: To ROF Dunham Hill, Cheshire, 2/1953

Name: Essex
Notes: Disposal as 325
